projects.title: Pok√©dexBot
descriptions: Pok√©dex Bot for Telegram can show you the list of all pok√©mon and give you the picture and description of that pok√©mon in return for you to enter the ID or name of the pok√©mon you requested.
NOTE: In the future, the bot can be rebuilt and published on another platform, instead of Heroku.

projects.title: Countrypedia
descriptions: An application where you can see all countries. This web application shows you the list of many countries, also you can search for countries, get information such as the flag, coat of arms, population, region of the country you selected.

NOTE: I plan to write the project from scratch with React and ChakraUI in 2023. This time I want to make improvements on both UI and UX side. Also, if the v3.2 version of the REST Countries API is released before this process is completed, I can add new information and write the object structures more easily in the project.

projects.title: Turkiye API
descriptions: This API allows you to get data about provinces/districts in Turkey/Turkiye. üáπüá∑
NOTE: I don't have any plans for this project at the moment, but I might consider it if you make a merge request.

projects.title: Simple To-Do App
descriptions: A simple to-do app built using Vue.js and tailwindcss.
I originally built this project in 2022 with Vue + tailwindcss. In 2023, I rewrote it using React + tailwindcss with exactly the same features.

NOTE: The name of the project was "Crema To-Do", I changed it to "Vue Simple To-Do App". because I'm planning to abandon this project and instead build a new to-do application from scratch, this time using a database. I will do this by opening a new repo and naming it "Crema To-Do". In short, the new project will take the old name of the current project.

projects.title: MovableArrow
descriptions: An application that has an arrow in the middle of the screen and you can move it using the arrow keys. Built with C#
NOTE: This is a console application, also a deprecated application.

projects.title: CremaBlog
descriptions: A blog app created with Node.js, Express, MongoDB, Mongoose etc. (Under development)

NOTE: To be honest, I'm not sure if I'll continue to develop. I'm not good at MongoDB actually and for now, the project has too many bugs. I'm trying to fix them but I'm not sure if I'll continue to develop.
